. While the coastline is mostly white sand beaches fronting the ocean full of tropical marine life, the interior is mountainous.

due to the intensity of its fire flies. Legend has it that Siquijor rose from the sea during a tremendous thunder storm and one can still see fossils and shells on Mount Bandila-an, Siquijor's highest point.

. There are also direct boats (Ocean Jet) to/from

the fast ferry (Delta shipping lines) and (GL shipping lines) from Dumaguete to Siquijor town cost from php120.
there is also (Montenegro shipping lines) car ferry from Dumaguete to Larena.
there is also a ferry from Larena to Plaridal on Mindanao island.

value: Hire a motorbike for around ₱350 per day (cheaper for long term). Available from Siquijor town and many resorts.
6 km northeast of Maria. Favourite with the locals and great for swimming and snorkelling. There are also water slides and places to dive into the sea.
Noted for its picturesque seascape and rock formation, it is situated below a cliff and accessible by concrete staircase.
Several white sand beach resorts dot the coastal areas.
Lots of beach resorts and great for snorkelling and scuba diving.
Impressive 3 tiered waterfalls just outside Lazi. Great for swimming.
Nice waterfall close to San Juan.
A natural spring fed swimming pool in the centre of San Juan. A favourite with the locals at weekends.
Takes 1.5 hrs to walk through and you need to register in the town before venturing inside. Local guide required (they hang around the cave) as the cave is locked up.

Reputed to be the biggest and one of the oldest convents in the Philippines, the Spaniards started construction in 1887 and was completed in 1894. Declared as a historical landmark by the Philippine Historical Commission.
Just outside Cang-apa. Sign posted from the main road.

content=In the center of town. They have a variety of dishes. ₱40 and up. Great chicken curry and soups.
content=3 km north of Siquijor going towards Larena. Good food, maybe the best on the island.
content=In center of town in Larena.
content=Great pizza using 100% imported meats and cheeses. Awesome sandwiches on French baguettes.
content=2 restaurants; main restaurant touts international cuisine next to the "Infinity" swimming pool and lounge area around the pool.

content=International restaurant, very clean and always well stocked. Imported and local drinks. Sports bar with 32 inch Cable TV. Alternate room reservations at local rate. Domestic flight bookings. Aberration Dive Club. Free Wi-Fi Internet DSL-Connection

Most people stay in some resort next to the beach around the island like San Juan. One quiet and remote option is the northwest tip of the island. If you don't mind staying away from the beach, try
in Siquijor town. It's a good value for money.

value: content=Located in the quiet northern tip of the island. Cottages with kitchen and rooms available. Daily scuba diving and massage available. Friendly Staff. Free Wi-Fi.
price=Double rooms with bathroom for ₱500 per night
content=Just outside San Juan. The other side of the road from the beach.
content=On San Juan beach. Dormitory available. double rooms. Restaurant with good food available too. Cottage rooms with queen-sized beds and outside bathrooms. All rooms have fans.
content=This is a great little resort with different cottages. Nice restaurant. Nice white beach; great for swimming. Great place to rest and read a book; no TV.
directions=Near Siquijor Town on the way to Larena

content=It has a decked restaurant and a clean kitchen with very good food. There are grand and unique cottages of various size and cost. All have sea views. The landscaped beach is well maintained and cleaned every morning. There are lots of hammocks and a pleasant garden with soft grass. Free Wi-Fi.
directions=Just behide the Siquijor town Hospital, 10-minute walk to town
content=Double fan rooms, some with and some without en suite bathrooms. Cable TV. Nice Garden. Good budget place to stay.
